context_bundle.summary: Identifying market conditions: Trend vs chop detection, volume analysis, volatility regimes, options expiry impact, liquidity assessment for bot strategy selection.

onboarding.quick_start: ADX >25 = trending. ADX <20 = ranging. Volume declining in range = breakout coming. Options expiry = volatility spike. Low liquidity (holidays) = avoid large positions.
common_patterns: Trend detection: ADX >25, price above/below MAs, higher highs/lows or lower
Chop detection: ADX <20, price oscillating around MAs, no clear structure
Volume analysis: Rising volume confirms moves, declining volume = exhaustion
Volatility regime: ATR expansion = trending, ATR contraction = ranging
Liquidity calendar: Options expiry (monthly/quarterly), holidays = thin books
known_errors: Using trend strategy in chop - whipsaw losses
Using range strategy in trend - missing big moves or getting stopped
Ignoring options expiry dates - unexpected volatility
Trading size too large in low liquidity - slippage kills
Confirmation bias - seeing trends that aren't there
